stimulusHtml: Which of the following statements correctly compares the values printed by the two code segments?

features.html:
Consider the following code segments, which are each intended to convert grades from a 100-point scale to a 4.0-point scale and print the result. A grade of 90 or above should yield a 4.0, a grade of 80 to 89 should yield a 3.0, a grade of 70 to 79 should yield a 2.0, and any grade lower than 70 should yield a 0.0.

 

Assume that  grade  is an  int  variable that has been properly declared and initialized.

 

Code Segment 1

double points = 0.0; 
if (grade > 89) 
{ 
   points = 4.0; 
} 
else if (grade > 79) 
{ 
   points = 3.0; 
} 
else if (grade > 69) 
{ 
   points = 2.0; 
} 
else 
{ 
   points = 0.0; 
} 
System.out.println(points);

 

Code Segment 2

double points = 0.0; 
if (grade > 89) 
{ 
   points = 4.0; 
} 
if (grade > 79) 
{ 
   points = 3.0; 
} 
if (grade > 69) 
{ 
   points = 2.0; 
} 
if (grade < 70) 
{ 
   points = 0.0; 
} 
System.out.println(points);

choicesHtml: The two code segments print the same value only when  grade  is below  80.
The two code segments print the same value only when  grade  is  90  or above.
Both code segments print the same value for all possible values of  grade.
The two code segments print different values for all possible values of  grade.
